articles.headline: The Phony Patriots of Silicon Valley
articles.snippet: Top tech companies are rallying around the flag. How opportunistic of them.
articles.abstract: Top tech companies are rallying around the flag. How opportunistic of them.
articles.lead_paragraph: Not long ago, many leading technologists considered themselves too lofty and idealistic to concern themselves with the petty affairs of government. John Perry Barlow, a lion of the early internet, addressed his “Declaration of the Independence of Cyberspace” to the “governments of the industrial world,” saying that for him and his fellow netizens, these creaky institutions had “no moral right to rule us nor do you possess any methods of enforcement we have true reason to fear.”

articles.headline: Democrats Want to Revive a Ban on Assault Weapons
articles.snippet: But with Republicans in charge of the Senate and President Trump in the White House, an assault weapons ban has little chance of being signed into law before 2021.
articles.abstract: But with Republicans in charge of the Senate and President Trump in the White House, an assault weapons ban has little chance of being signed into law before 2021.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Twenty-five years ago, Democratic support for an assault weapons ban was a major reason the party lost control of the House. Now top Democrats want to revive the fight.

articles.headline: The Day Jeffrey Epstein Told Me He Had Dirt on Powerful People
articles.snippet: I went to Mr. Epstein’s Manhattan mansion to talk about Tesla. We ended up discussing much more — including his belief that sex with teenage girls should be acceptable.
articles.abstract: I went to Mr. Epstein’s Manhattan mansion to talk about Tesla. We ended up discussing much more — including his belief that sex with teenage girls should be acceptable.
articles.lead_paragraph: Almost exactly a year ago, on Aug. 16, 2018, I visited Jeffrey Epstein at his cavernous Manhattan mansion.

articles.headline: Protests Put Hong Kong on Collision Course With China’s Communist Party
articles.snippet: The grand political experiment to marry Beijing’s brand of authoritarianism with a bastion of civil liberties appears to be facing a moment of reckoning.
articles.abstract: The grand political experiment to marry Beijing’s brand of authoritarianism with a bastion of civil liberties appears to be facing a moment of reckoning.
articles.lead_paragraph: HONG KONG — As anti-government demonstrations escalate in Hong Kong, each side is staking out increasingly polarized positions, making it difficult to find a path to compromise between the protesters and China’s ruling Communist Party.
articles.byline: By Javier C. Hernández and Amy Qin

articles.headline: Chaos Grips Hong Kong’s Airport as Police Clash With Protesters
articles.snippet: Protesters stopped some travelers from reaching their departure gates, hours after the city’s leader pleaded for order amid escalating unrest.
articles.abstract: Protesters stopped some travelers from reaching their departure gates, hours after the city’s leader pleaded for order amid escalating unrest.
articles.lead_paragraph: HONG KONG — Anti-government protesters clashed with Hong Kong riot police on Tuesday, crippling the airport for the second straight day and targeting a potent symbol of the city’s position as a global center of commerce and finance that is essential to China.
articles.byline: By Mike Ives, Ezra Cheung and Elsie Chen

articles.headline: Trump’s Push to Bring Back Jobs to U.S. Shows Limited Results
articles.snippet: Tax cuts and tariffs have not caused a significant return of factory activity, data from the government and other sources show.
articles.abstract: Tax cuts and tariffs have not caused a significant return of factory activity, data from the government and other sources show.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — From tax cuts to relaxed regulations to tariffs, each of President Trump’s economic initiatives is based on a promise: to set off a wave of investment and bring back jobs that the president says the United States has lost to foreign countries.

articles.headline: Ads Pitching CBD as a Cure-All Are Everywhere. Oversight Hasn’t Kept Up.
articles.snippet: “Basically nobody” is overseeing the quality of the many cannabidiol products that have proliferated, one researcher said. The F.D.A. says it is doing everything it can.
articles.abstract: “Basically nobody” is overseeing the quality of the many cannabidiol products that have proliferated, one researcher said. The F.D.A. says it is doing everything it can.
articles.lead_paragraph: Scientists at Virginia Commonwealth University in Richmond, Va., were concerned when a young man contacted their department last year complaining of a heart-pounding, hallucinogenic high he had neither expected nor wanted to have.

articles.headline: U.S. Delays Some China Tariffs Until Stores Stock Up for Holidays
articles.snippet: President Trump pushed off imposing a new 10 percent tariff on cellphones, laptop computers, toys and other goods until Dec. 15. Some other items were excluded altogether.
articles.abstract: President Trump pushed off imposing a new 10 percent tariff on cellphones, laptop computers, toys and other goods until Dec. 15. Some other items were excluded altogether.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump on Tuesday unexpectedly put off new tariffs on many Chinese goods, including cellphones, laptop computers and toys, until after the start of the Christmas shopping season, acknowledging the effect that his protracted trade war with Beijing could have on Americans.
